message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.SY, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a framework for adaptive activity monitoring using switching Gaussian process models. This involves machine learning techniques such as Bayesian loss function and Fast Fourier Transforms for inference. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also deals with uncertainty quantification, which is a common theme in sub-categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The application of the framework is in healthcare, which falls under the sub-category cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction and Computer-Supported Cooperative Work). Finally, the use of sensors and power-efficient sensing schemes suggests the sub-category cs.SY (Systems and Control).
